page.title: 18THE RIVER CAMEL
page.content: The Camel runs to the north of Nanstallon,where it has made a small flood plain.{Wadebridge Flood Scheme} and new reservors mean that the water seldom reaches the top of the banks now.Shallow water and clearance of growth,except for a very wild section north of Butterwell,gives less cover for animals and fish.A local angler, Mr.J.Cumine,told us he caught a 12lb{ {salmon}and many good{sea}and{brown {trout.}He often saw and heard{otters.} Bodmin and Wadebridge angling clubs have areas reserved,but fishing is not good now and{mink}have taken over.A survey has shown that oxygen content of the water decreases where the streams enter the Camel.Lower forms of life have decreased.The future does not look bright.
